pr_title: gRPC memory leak fix + bench test app

timeline.message: update test app readme with new options
add wait option for interactive start/end
add deadline and fix too deep nested calls
fix memory leak by terminating at 'onHalfClose'
move random port to core module
avoid using all server threads in tests

timeline.bodyText: this change was the one that fixed the memory leak, as it seems that some calls to onComplete are not always executed at all, or are executed in an unexpected order.
timeline.author: SylvainJuge

replies.bodyText:
I don't think that's the issue. The problem is that we're only instrumenting server call listeners, that contain Unary in the class name. The UnaryServerCallListener doesn't override the noop onComplete callback.
Another issue is that the transaction is ended in co.elastic.apm.agent.grpc.ServerCallInstrumentation#onExit (on ServerCall#close). The effect is that even when instrumenting io.grpc.ServerCall.Listener#onComplete, the helper is not called, because the transaction has already ended.
Furthermore, the fact that inFlightServerListeners is of type WeakConcurrentMap<ServerCall.Listener<?>, ServerCall<?, ?>> imposes a risk of a memory leak as ServerCall is not a weak reference. Have you considered mapping directly to the transaction (WeakConcurrentMap<ServerCall.Listener<?>, Transaction>)?
Similar story for client instrumentation. Changing the signature to WeakConcurrentMap<ClientCall.Listener<?>, Span> inFlightClientListeners would eliminate the chance of leaks and allows direct lookup of a span given a listener.
Another simplification of the client instrumentation could be done by removing co.elastic.apm.agent.grpc.ClientCallImplInstrumentation.Constructor and doing that inside co.elastic.apm.agent.grpc.ChannelInstrumentation (which instruments io.grpc.Channel#newCall). That would be more in line with the server instrumentation in co.elastic.apm.agent.grpc.ServerCallHandlerInstrumentation (instrumenting io.grpc.ServerCallHandler#startCall). And allows you to start the span before the constructor is invoked. In the exit advice you can then use the return value.
replies.author: felixbarny

timeline.bodyText: this allows to have more than one test running on the same host without conflict.
timeline.author: SylvainJuge

timeline.bodyText: this one deserves a facepalm and was the cause of the failure on CI, as CI server has less cores than a decent laptop (likely 4), thus server was running with 2 threads in thread pool, which makes the 3rd nested call fail with a missed deadline.
timeline.author: SylvainJuge

timeline.bodyText: adding a deadline makes remote calls fail with timeout instead of waiting forever.
timeline.author: SylvainJuge

timeline.bodyText: You can also use port 0 which makes it open a random free port, without you having to manually try port after port.
timeline.author: felixbarny

timeline.message: implement changes suggested by felix after review
make client part similar to server & simpler
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:elastic/apm-agent-java into fix-grpc-leak

timeline.bodyText: Why do we only support unary calls?
timeline.author: felixbarny

replies.bodyText: Good question, first, that's on par with what other elastic APM agents provide, avoid extra complexity when adding this feature, and then there was the case of bi-directional streaming which might not fit the concept of "transaction" if it's used as a long-lived communication channel, but that might really be a marginal use. Thus we could probably lift this limitation in the near future in a separate PR.
replies.author: SylvainJuge

replies.bodyText: Please create a follow-up issue for that.
replies.author: felixbarny

timeline.bodyText: Why are we not starting the transaction onEnter anymore? That's what we also do for client calls. It also ensures we measure the time spent when preparing the call, including listener executions.
timeline.author: felixbarny

replies.bodyText: fair point, it was a way to make instrumentation a bit simpler with only one single call to helper class. I've changed that in last commit.
replies.author: SylvainJuge

timeline.bodyText: Also instrument onReady to propagate context and to end the span if an exception occurs.
timeline.author: felixbarny

timeline.bodyText: don't we have to end the transaction in case of an exception?
timeline.author: felixbarny

replies.bodyText: Do we have a test that checks if other callbacks and/or io.grpc.ServerCall#close is called if an exception happens?
replies.author: felixbarny

replies.bodyText: server-side tests have been added in latest version of PR.
replies.author: SylvainJuge

timeline.message: add more tests for listener + no nested tx
add log4j2.xml to avoid log4j from complaining
